settings.heading: What is Menopause?
settings.description: Menopause is a natural biological process marking the end of menstrual cycles. Understanding this transition helps you navigate it with confidence.

settings.stage_description: The transition phase leading up to menopause

settings.intro_text: Menopause typically occurs between ages 45-55, with the average age being 51. It's diagnosed after you've gone 12 consecutive months without a menstrual period.
settings.treatment_text: Various treatment options are available to help manage menopause symptoms. Menopausal Hormone Therapy (MHT) is one effective option that many women consider.
